DataElement.preferredName: Primary Malignant Neoplasm Anatomic Site Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe the anatomic site of the primary malignant neoplasm.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value._A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._Named locations of or within the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original. (American Heritage Dictionary):A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

ReferenceDocuments.description: PerformedDiagnosis > TargetAnatomicSite.code(CD).originalText WHERE PerformedDiagnosis.value = "Neuroblastoma" AND TargetAnatomicSite.code(CD).nullFlavor = "OTH" AND PerformedDiagnosis > PerformedObservation > DefinedObservation.nameCode = "evaluate for disease"
